com.qtplaf.library.swing.core

Class JOptionDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Dialog
            • javax.swing.JDialog
              • com.qtplaf.library.swing.core.JDialogSession
                • com.qtplaf.library.swing.core.JOptionDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class JOptionDialog
extends JDialogSession
    An option dialog in the fashion of the JOptionPane, more friendly and under the total control of this library.
    Author:
    Miquel Sas
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • addOption

        public void addOption(java.lang.String option,
                      java.lang.String description,
                      javax.swing.Icon smallIcon,
                      javax.swing.KeyStroke acceleratorKey,
                      boolean defaultClose)
        Adds an option.
        Parameters:
        option - The option name or string.
        description - The optional option description.
        smallIcon - The optional option small icon.
        acceleratorKey - The optional option accelerator key.
        defaultClose - A boolean that indicates if the option is the default close option.

      • addOption

        public void addOption(javax.swing.Action action)
        Add an option in the for of an action that is expected to have a name or source name at least. It can also have the common attributes, short description, accelerator key, action group.

        This option dialog is set as the user object, so it can be retrieved when the action is executed.

        Parameters:
        action - The action. One of them should be the default close action.
